qas.question: What are other terms for logical empiricism?
What did logical empiricism try to combine with mathematical logic?
What was Otto Neurath an important member of?
What was AJ Ayer an important member of?
When were Gottlob Frege's mathematical insights published?
What was Ludwig Wittgenstein part of?

context: <a3_0><a4_0>Logical empiricism<a4_0/><a3_0/> (also <a0_0>logical positivism or neopositivism<a0_0/>) was an <a1_0><b5_0>early 20th-century<b5_0/><a1_0/> attempt to synthesize the essential ideas of <a2_0><b8_0>British<b8_0/> empiricism<a2_0/> (e.g. a strong emphasis on sensory experience as the basis for knowledge) with certain insights from mathematical logic that had been developed by Gottlob Frege and Ludwig Wittgenstein. Some of the key figures in this movement were <b9_0>Otto Neurath, Moritz Schlick<b9_0/> and the rest of <b6_0><b7_0>the Vienna Circle<b7_0/><b6_0/>, along with A.J. Ayer, Rudolf Carnap and Hans Reichenbach.
